parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To clean (cleanse) out, clean thoroughly. From ek and kathairo; to cleanse thoroughly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
Leaven, ferment, both lit. and met. Probably from zeo; ferment.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(in the neutral plural) specially (by implication) the Passover week.
A mass or lump, as of bread dough. From a prolonged form of phuro, mean to knead; a mass of dough.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to rush, i.e. to sacrifice; by extension to immolate.
